title: Art Langer Joins Marlabs Board
text:
PISCATAWAY, New Jersey, February 1, 2018 /PRNewswire/ --
Marlabs, a next generation digital innovation, infrastructure, security and product engineering services company, announced the appointment of Art Langer as Non-Executive Director on the board.
(Photo: https://mma.prnewswire.com/media/636466/Art_Langer_Joins_Marlabs_Board.jpg )
Dr. Arthur M. Langer is the Director of the Center for Technology Management at Columbia University. At Columbia's School of Professional Studies, he is Professor of Professional Practice and Academic Director of the Technology Management programs. He also serves on the faculty of the Department of Organization and Leadership at the Graduate School of Education (Teachers College). He has numerous published articles and papers relating to service learning for underserved populations, IT organizational integration, mentoring, and staff development. Dr. Langer consults with corporations and universities worldwide on information technology, staff development, management transformation, and curriculum development.
Welcoming Art Langer to the Marlabs Board, Siby Vadakekkara Chairman & CEO, said, "We are excited about Art joining our Board. Art will provide fresh insights to our technology and digital practices as we continue to help our customers drive digital innovation at an accelerated pace. His experience as a social entrepreneur, and as a thought leader in digital disruption will be invaluable to Marlabs and to our customers in this new digital business environment."
On his appointment, Art said, "I am glad to be part of the Marlabs' board and most excited about guiding them in their digital lab initiatives around AI, ML and Block chain. I have known Marlabs for a while and it's been fulfilling to watch their growth and would be a joy to work with their innovative and dynamic leadership team."
New Jersey-headquartered Marlabs has a dedicated team of over 2,300 employees, a network of delivery centers in the US, Canada and India and strong partnerships with industry leaders. Marlabs has been associated with Columbia University for several years on the CIO leadership program and mentorship support for Columbia's programs on technology management.
About Marlabs
Marlabs enables digital innovation for enterprises and technology providers by delivering seamless customer experience, business efficiency and actionable insights through an integrated set of disruptive technologies: cognitive computing platforms, internet of things, mobility, cloud, managed infrastructure and customer experience management.
Headquartered in Piscataway, New Jersey Marlabs has operations in the US, Canada and India.
